suspended_title: A new update for this app is available.
suspended_message: Update this app because this version has some issues.

guides.title: What Is Magisk Manager
guides.text: Magisk is a popular tool for rooting Android devices[1]. To install Magisk, users should first download the flashable zip file from XDA[2], then reboot their device into recovery mode and flash the zip file[1]. After installation, users can open the Magisk Manager app to access the download section and search for modules[3]. To install modules, users should use either samfirm.js, Frija, or Samloader to download the latest firmware zip of their device directly from Samsung servers[4], unzip it and then use the Install from Storage button in the Magisk app to install the module[5].

guides.title: how to install magisk manager
guides.text: To install Magisk, users should first identify the type of boot image on their device[1], locate the boot image and patch it[1], then push the Magisk file over to their Android device[2]. On the device, they should tap the option to install from a .zip, locate the Magisk file and flash it[2]. If Magisk is already installed, users can upgrade directly via the Magisk app using its “Direct Install” method[3].

guides.title: magisk manager features
guides.text: Magisk Manager is an app which grants root or superuser permissions to applications that request it[1]. It can be used to run banking apps and pass SafetyNet tests[2], as well as customize the device and add various functionalities[3]. Popular Magisk modules include Magisk Manager Recovery Tool, Magisk Bootloop Saver, App Systemizer, HideNavBar, Viper4Android FX, Open Fonts, iOS13.2 Emoji and more[4][5].

guides.title: magisk manager root access
guides.text: Magisk Manager is an app which can be used to gain root access on Android devices[1][2][3][4]. It is a well-developed rooting application that reportedly does not include any sort of malware[4]. To root a device with Magisk, users need the tool itself which grants root access, as well as other necessary components[5].

guides.title: how to use magisk manager
guides.text: To use Magisk Manager, first install the latest version of the app from XDA Developers[1], then reboot your device into recovery mode[2]. After that, you can install root from Magisk Manager[3], update the application[3], verify SafetyNet[3], and uninstall modules[4].

guides.title: magisk manager proper use
guides.text: The proper use of Magisk Manager involves downloading the latest version of the app from XDA Developers[1], rebooting your device into recovery mode[2], installing root from Magisk Manager[3], updating the application[3], verifying SafetyNet[3], and uninstalling modules[4]. Additionally, users can use samfirm.js, Frija, or Samloader to download the latest firmware zip of their device directly from Samsung servers and unzip it to copy the AP file for installation[5].
